definitions: tool or machine designed to divide something into separate parts
person whose role involves dividing or separating materials or groups
examples: The log splitter made quick work of the firewood pile
He bought a cable splitter to connect multiple televisions
The wood splitter worked through the winter preparing fuel
The vote splitter divided the party into opposing factions

definitions: goods or benefits taken by force or as a prize
earth and rock removed during excavation or mining operations
examples: The spoils of war were divided among the victorious soldiers
Political spoils went to the winning party's supporters
Construction spoil was hauled away in dump trucks daily
Mining spoil formed huge mounds around the quarry entrance

definitions: process or result of food becoming unfit for consumption through decay
loss of materials or products during manufacturing or storage processes
examples: Refrigeration significantly reduces spoilage in fresh produce departments
The restaurant tracked spoilage to minimize food waste costs
Manufacturing spoilage rates dropped after implementing quality controls
Insurance covered spoilage of goods damaged during shipping delays

definitions: person who reveals important plot details of a story or film
device on vehicles that disrupts airflow to reduce lift and increase stability
competitor who prevents another from winning without winning themselves
examples: The movie review contained major spoilers about the ending
She posted a spoiler warning before discussing the book
The race car's rear spoiler improved high-speed handling significantly
He added an aftermarket spoiler to his sedan
The third-party candidate acted as a spoiler in the election
Their team became spoilers by defeating the championship favorites

definitions: act or process of becoming damaged, decayed, or unusable
practice of giving someone excessive attention or material goods
examples: Proper storage prevents spoiling of perishable food items
The spoiling of the milk was evident from its smell
Grandparents are often accused of spoiling their grandchildren excessively
The spoiling of the child led to behavioral problems

definitions: rod extending from the hub to the rim of a wheel
horizontal bar forming a step in a ladder structure
examples: The bicycle spoke broke during the mountain descent yesterday
Wooden spokes gave the antique wagon wheel its character
He climbed each spoke of the corporate ladder methodically
The broken spoke made the ladder unsafe to use

definitions: man who speaks officially on behalf of a group or organization
examples: The company spokesman addressed reporters at the press conference
A government spokesman declined to comment on the allegations

definitions: person authorized to speak on behalf of an organization or group
examples: The hospital spokesperson provided updates on the patient's condition
A spokesperson for the mayor confirmed the policy changes

definitions: woman who speaks officially on behalf of a group or organization
examples: The spokeswoman outlined the company's new environmental initiatives
A White House spokeswoman briefed journalists this morning

definitions: porous material used for cleaning or absorbing liquids
simple aquatic animal with a porous body lacking true tissues
person who lives at others' expense without contributing
examples: She wiped the counter with a damp kitchen sponge
The car washing sponge absorbed soap and water efficiently
Marine biologists studied sponge colonies on the coral reef
Natural sponges have been harvested from these waters for centuries
His brother was a sponge who never paid rent
Don't be a sponge; contribute your fair share

definitions: person or organization that provides funds for an activity or event
individual who organizes or takes responsibility for an event or program
person who supports or champions a cause, proposal, or individual
examples: The corporate sponsor donated millions to the sports tournament
Local sponsors helped fund the community arts festival
The bill's sponsor presented it to the legislative committee
She acted as sponsor for the charity fundraising event
His sponsor in the recovery program provided crucial support
Immigration sponsors must meet specific financial requirements

definitions: provision of funds or resources to support an activity, person, or organization
act of taking responsibility for or supporting someone or something officially
examples: Corporate sponsorship kept the arts program running despite budget cuts
The team secured sponsorship from a major technology company
Her sponsorship of the refugee family lasted three years
The senator's sponsorship of the bill ensured its passage

definitions: quality of occurring naturally without planning, external cause, or constraint
examples: The spontaneity of their laughter filled the room with joy
Travel plans lacking spontaneity can feel overly rigid

definitions: light-hearted imitation of something, typically for comic effect
hoax or trick involving deception, especially in digital communications
examples: The comedy show's spoof of the presidential debate went viral
They created a spoof advertisement mocking luxury brands
Email spoofs can trick users into revealing personal information
The caller ID spoof made it appear legitimate

definitions: supernatural being or ghost that haunts a location
informal term for a spy or intelligence agent
horse that has been startled or frightened
examples: Children dressed as spooks for the Halloween parade
Old mansion spooks kept tourists away after dark
The retired spook wrote memoirs about Cold War operations
Government spooks monitored international communications
The spook bolted when the car backfired nearby
That horse is a spook around loud noises

definitions: cylinder on which thread, wire, or other flexible materials are wound
temporary storage area for data awaiting processing in computing
examples: The sewing machine spool ran out of thread mid-seam
Cable spools lined the construction site perimeter
Print jobs accumulated in the printer spool overnight
The spool file grew too large for the system

definitions: utensil with a shallow bowl and handle for eating or serving
standardized implement for measuring ingredients in cooking
type of golf club with a lofted face
examples: She stirred her coffee with a silver spoon
The baby learned to eat with a spoon
Add two spoons of sugar to the mixture
A measuring spoon ensures consistent recipe results
His wooden spoon helped escape the sand trap
Vintage golf spoons are valuable collector items

definitions: amount that a spoon can hold when filled
examples: Just a spoonful of medicine helps symptoms disappear quickly
She added several spoonfuls of honey to her tea

definitions: reproductive cell capable of developing into a new organism without fusion
examples: Mushroom spores spread through the forest after rainfall
Fern spores developed on the underside of fronds

definitions: competitive physical activity governed by rules and requiring skill
source of amusement or entertainment for participants or spectators
plant or animal showing unusual variation from the parent type
examples: Basketball became her favorite sport in high school
Professional sport generates billions in revenue annually
Fox hunting was considered a gentleman's sport historically
They made sport of the newcomer's accent
The white rose was a sport of the red variety
This sport showed unique coloration patterns

definitions: person who broadcasts commentary on sporting events for television or radio
examples: The sportscaster provided play-by-play coverage of the championship game
Famous sportscasters often become celebrities in their own right

definitions: man who participates in sports, especially professionally
person who exhibits fairness and grace in competition
examples: The sportsman trained daily for the upcoming tournament
Professional sportsmen often endorse athletic products
A true sportsman accepts defeat with dignity and grace
His sportsman conduct earned respect from opponents

definitions: ethical and respectful behavior exhibited in sports competition and beyond
examples: Good sportsmanship includes congratulating opponents after losing
The award for sportsmanship went to the most gracious player

definitions: clothing designed for sports or physical exercise, often worn casually
examples: The sportswear section featured moisture-wicking fabrics and designs
Designer sportswear has become acceptable office attire

definitions: woman who participates in sports, especially at a professional level
examples: The sportswoman broke three records during her career
Young sportswomen need more media coverage and sponsorship opportunities

definitions: journalist who specializes in writing about sports and athletic events
examples: The sportswriter covered every home game for thirty years
Veteran sportswriters debated the season's most valuable player

definitions: particular place or position in space
small mark or stain different in color from its surroundings
brief advertisement or designated time for broadcasting
examples: This spot offers the best view of the sunset
She found a parking spot near the entrance
The ink spot ruined her favorite white shirt
Leopards are known for their distinctive spots
The company bought a prime-time spot for their commercial
Radio spots are cheaper than television advertising

definitions: powerful light directed onto a small area for illumination
intense public attention or scrutiny focused on someone or something
examples: The spotlight illuminated the lead actor during her monologue
Stage spotlights created dramatic effects throughout the performance
The scandal put the company in an unwelcome spotlight
She enjoyed her moment in the spotlight after winning

definitions: person who observes and identifies specific things or assists in locating them
person who assists and ensures safety during weightlifting exercises
examples: The bird spotter identified twelve rare species that morning
Military spotters helped direct artillery fire accurately
His spotter helped him complete the heavy bench press
Always use a spotter when attempting maximum lifts

definitions: act of observing and identifying specific objects or phenomena
light vaginal bleeding occurring outside regular menstruation
examples: Train spotting became his favorite weekend hobby
Wildlife spotting requires patience and good binoculars
She experienced spotting during early pregnancy
Spotting between periods warranted medical consultation

definitions: person's husband or wife in a legally recognized marriage
examples: Both spouses must sign the mortgage application together
Military spouses face unique challenges during deployments

definitions: projecting tube or lip for pouring liquid from a container
stream of liquid or gas forcefully ejected from an opening
examples: The teapot's spout was decorated with gold leaf
Pour carefully through the spout to avoid spills
The whale's spout was visible from the boat deck
Water shot from the broken pipe spout

definitions: injury caused by wrenching or twisting a ligament violently
examples: Her ankle sprain required six weeks of physical therapy
The athlete suffered a severe sprain during practice

definitions: uncontrolled expansion of urban development into surrounding areas
casual spreading position of a person or thing
examples: Urban sprawl consumed farmland at an alarming rate
Suburban sprawl created traffic and infrastructure problems
His sprawl across the couch blocked others from sitting
The cat's sprawl in the sunbeam looked comfortable

definitions: spreading out over a large area in an irregular way
examples: The sprawling campus covered over five hundred acres
Her sprawling handwriting filled the entire page

definitions: liquid dispersed as fine droplets in air
pressurized container that dispenses liquid as fine particles
arrangement of flowers or foliage on a single branch
examples: Ocean spray coated the windshield with salt water
The perfume spray filled the room with fragrance
She kept pepper spray in her purse for protection
The paint spray provided even coverage quickly
The florist added a spray of baby's breath
Cherry blossom sprays decorated the wedding venue

definitions: act of dispersing liquid or particles in fine droplets
examples: Spraying pesticides requires protective equipment and careful timing
The spraying of water cooled the overheated crowd

definitions: extent or range of something across an area
soft food mixture for spreading on bread or crackers
difference between two rates, prices, or values
large meal or impressive display of items
examples: The spread of the disease worried health officials
The fire's spread threatened nearby homes
She prepared a cheese spread for the party
The chocolate spread was the children's favorite
The spread between bid and ask prices widened
Interest rate spreads indicated economic uncertainty
The holiday spread impressed all the dinner guests
Their spread included dishes from five different cuisines

definitions: tool or machine for distributing material over an area
person or thing that transmits disease or information widely
examples: The fertilizer spreader ensured even lawn coverage
Salt spreaders prepared roads for winter storms
The super spreader infected dozens at the event
Social media spreaders amplified the misinformation

definitions: act of extending or distributing something over a wider area
examples: The spreading of rumors damaged her reputation significantly
Spreading mulch helps retain soil moisture effectively

definitions: computer application for organizing data in rows and columns for calculation
examples: The financial spreadsheet tracked quarterly expenses and revenues
She created a spreadsheet to manage wedding guest lists

definitions: period of unrestrained activity or indulgence in a particular behavior
examples: Their shopping spree emptied three credit cards
The crime spree lasted two weeks before arrests

definitions: small stem with leaves or flowers taken from a plant
examples: She garnished the dish with a sprig of parsley
A sprig of holly decorated each place setting

definitions: season between winter and summer marked by growth and warming
elastic device that returns to shape after compression or extension
natural source of water flowing from the ground
sudden jump or leap from one position to another
examples: Spring brings cherry blossoms to the capital city
The spring semester starts in late January
The mattress spring poked through the worn fabric
Clock springs need careful handling during repair
The mountain spring provided fresh drinking water
Hot springs attracted tourists to the resort town
The cat's spring caught the mouse off guard
His spring into action surprised everyone present

definitions: flexible board used for diving or gymnastics
something that provides an opportunity for further development or progress
examples: The Olympic diver practiced on the three-meter springboard
The gymnastics springboard helped her complete the vault
Her internship became a springboard to full-time employment
The scholarship served as a springboard for his career

definitions: breed of spaniel dog known for springing game birds
bottom stone of an arch where the curve begins
examples: The springer spaniel flushed quail from the underbrush
English springers make excellent hunting companions
The mason carefully positioned the springer stone
Gothic springers supported the cathedral's massive arches

definitions: the season of spring or the period characteristic of spring
examples: Springtime allergies affected millions of people nationwide
The garden looked beautiful in the springtime sunshine

definitions: light shower or scattering of liquid or particles
small quantity scattered or distributed over something
examples: A sprinkle of rain barely wet the pavement
The baker added a sprinkle of cinnamon
Just a sprinkle of doubt remained in her mind
A sprinkle of humor lightened the serious presentation

definitions: device that sprays water for irrigation or fire suppression
examples: The lawn sprinkler ran every morning at six
Fire sprinklers activated when smoke was detected

definitions: small number or amount of something scattered over an area
examples: A sprinkling of stars appeared as darkness fell
The audience included a sprinkling of celebrities
